properties.description:
Moonlight Buttress

Rating: 5.8 C1

The most famous Zion line. While you need adequate climbing experience and skills to complete this route, you can often enjoy the view from the road, as this route sees plenty of traffic throughout the climbing season

JEM Trail

Rating: Intermediate

A heavily trafficked system of cross country trails consisting of beginner to moderate difficulty. Excellent for visitors looking to get the desert Mountain Bike experience without the fear of extreme downhill riding.

'," target="_blank" title="Opens in a new window">Dead Horse Point Tour

Rating: Blue Square

A mellow, but rewarding singletrack adventure that travels along the edge of the famous Dead Horse state park, giving riders an unbeatable view above Canyonlands National Park.

Gooseberry Mesa

Rating: Intermediate/Advanced

The premiere Slickrock trail in the greater Zion Area. The undulating dips and twists of Gooseberry Mesa have made it one of the most popular Mountain Biking Trails in the world. While not for absolute beginners, most riders will find something enjoyable to ride.

The Narrows

Difficulty: Novice

The Narrows is the most famous and trafficked trail in Zion. Not for the faint of heart, the trail does require hikers to enter the Virgin River itself and hike up stream. It is recommended that rent gear from a local Outfitter for this hike

The West Rim Trail

Difficulty: Intermediate

An amazing 13 mile backpacking trail that begins in the high alpine and traverses back into Zion canyon.

Springdale

The gateway community to Zion National Park, Springdale is the first stop for all of your adventure needs. Lodging, Outfitters, and a wealth of Restaurants can be find in this small desert town.

Emerald Pools

This is a short and potentially quick out-and-back hike, depending on how long you decide to stop at each pool. Given the high volume of visitors that flock to this attraction, the trail has been brandished with guardrails and barriers to keep both people and the natural environment safe.

The Whole Guacamole

Difficulty: Difficult

The Whole Guacamole trail is a lot of fun to ride with some singletrack thrown in and lots of slick rock type riding and technical features. Trail finding can be challenging in a few areas so watch for small rock cairns.

Lamb's Knoll

Rating: Various

A popular sport climbing area found on the border of Zion National Park. There are several popular climbs in this area, as well as various canyoneering routes.

Canyon Overlook

Difficulty: Novice

This short trail originates at a parking lot on the east side of the highway 9 (Zion Park Blvd.) tunnel. The trail traverses out to the rim above a steep canyon wall. Views to the west are breathtaking from the overlook.

Namaste

Difficulty: 5.11d

Popular area for climbing photography. The Namaste Wall is a sheer cliff of beautiful hueco's with good holds.
